item.title: The latest example of Capitol Hill’s geriatric problem
item.description: Eleanor Holmes Norton’s staff rejects D.C. police’s “early stages of dementia” description of her.

item.title: Vaccine mistrust is hurting people. Two pilots decided to act.
item.description: Too many people remain unaware of the dangers of vaccine-preventable diseases.

item.title: The Supreme Court won’t hurt America by striking down the tariffs
item.description: Despite the Trump administration’s warnings, the economy will not suffer from obeying the Constitution.

item.title: I emigrated from Vietnam. Halloween in America astonished me.
item.description: Coming from communist-run Vietnam, I was baffled by glimpses of life in my new home.

item.title: The U.S. is poised to rock Russia and China — if it holds firm
item.description: To change the behavior of Putin and Xi, new sanctions need to keep biting.

item.title: Pardon me
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on Binance CEO pardon.

item.title: What the FBI gambling probe says about the NBA
item.description: Readers respond to Post articles and commentary.

item.title: As Trump seeks another meeting with Kim Jong Un, it’s not 2019 anymore
item.description: A more emboldened and dangerous North Korea, closer to Russia and China, makes unacceptable demands.

item.title: Japan’s new prime minister has two excellent models for Trump summit
item.description: Sanae Takaichi would do well to channel Shinzo Abe and Margaret Thatcher in her U.S. dealings.

item.title: Argentina’s landslide election should be good news to American ears
item.description: Javier Milei’s painful but necessary reform project gets needed momentum from voters.

item.title: China’s trade bullying calls for an Article 5
item.description: Trade interdependence is a two-way street, and China is not the only one with leverage.

item.title: Virginia’s attorney general race shows how the office has changed
item.description: Too much national policy is getting made through federal courts.

item.title: Trump is circling Maduro. This points to a dark history.
item.description: The White House is ratcheting up military pressure on Venezuelan dictator Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: London’s sad decline is a warning to New Yorkers
item.description: In three terms as mayor, Sadiq Khan has crushed the economic life out of Britain’s capital.

item.title: A one-year reprieve from Chinese rare earth blackmail
item.description: Weekend talks eased tensions, but deep mistrust will continue to define the relationship.

item.title: The exploding cigar of mid-decade gerrymandering
item.description: Texas Republicans invited partisan warfare. As Virginia follows, the biggest losers will be voters.
